properties.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Casper Mountain
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 2 at 2:35PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
The combination of strong winds and fresh snow cover is resulting
in areas of blowing snow across the area. These conditions will
likely persist through tonight and Tuesday morning.

* WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow along with winds of 30 to 40
mph and gusts of 45 to occasionally 55 mph. Some of the stronger
gusts will likely occur along Outer Drive just south of Casper.
A gust of 57 mph was reported along outer Drive at 9:30 AM this
morning.

* WHERE...The lower elevations of Natrona County, including
Casper. Casper Mountain will also have these conditions but with
sightly less wind speed.

* WHEN...The rest of this afternoon, tonight, and through about 11
AM Tuesday morning. Casper Mountain will continue to experience
some blowing and drifting snow through most of the day Tuesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If out driving on area highways during this
time frame, anticipate rapidly fluctuating visibility due to
blowing and drifting snow. The visibility will briefly drop to
near zero at times in some areas.

NWSheadline: Strong winds and blowing snow for the rest of this afternoon, through Tuesday morning
